intro: Galium parisiense f. anglicum, commonly known as English bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial that features slender, ascending stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters, typically blooming from June to August. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks.
